body:
Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**.

**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

`tracking.MlflowClient.list_run_infos` provides a convenience wrapper around `search_runs`, but doesn't surface the pagination support which `search_runs` provides. This FR is to surface the necessary parameters/return handling.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? This will be beneficial for users who have a significant number of runs.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? It will allow for the continued use of the `list_run_infos` convenience function even as users scale up in the number of runs they have.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? As above, the continued use of the convenience function will be valuable to users at scale.
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient). Users are currently forced to change how they interact with MLflow as their use case scales, which while not impossible is detrimental to user experience.
